comments:
Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create a plugin project 
2. Add a dependency to org.eclipse.ui.examples.filesystem
3. create a simple EFS filestore (which is non-local)
4. create an action which attempts to open the default editor on this filestore



More information:
I am trying to open a DefaultTextEditor on a FileStoreEditorInput - which wraps a simple EFS implementation.

But, the editor has problems and fails with a non-null assertion ....

the stack trace is like this:

I have prepared a simple test case (a plugin project) - which utilises the org.eclipse.ui.examples.filesystem to obtain a memory based file.

An exercpt from the code is:

			try {
				
				//  create an in-memory filestore 
				
				IFileSystem filesystem = EFS.getFileSystem("memory");
				IFileStore store = filesystem.getStore(new Path("/dummy.txt"));

				//  write some text to it... 
				
				store.openOutputStream(0, null);

				OutputStream os = store.openOutputStream(EFS.APPEND, null);
				BufferedOutputStream bos = new BufferedOutputStream(os);

				String[] contents = { "<test>", "<hi>world</hi>", "</test>" };
				for (String s : contents) {
					bos.write(s.getBytes());
				}
				bos.close();
				System.out.println("written to filestore");

				//  read it back out - to verify that we can read it ok 
				
				InputStream is = store.openInputStream(0, null);
				InputStreamReader isr = new InputStreamReader(is);
				int c;
				StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
				while ((c = isr.read()) != -1) {
					sb.append((char) c);
				}
				is.close();
				
				System.out.println("result is:" + sb.toString());

				//  try and open the default editor on the filestore 

				org.eclipse.ui.ide.FileStoreEditorInput input = new org.eclipse.ui.ide.FileStoreEditorInput(
						store);

				System.out.println("now got input ok");

				String sId = "org.eclipse.ui.DefaultTextEditor";
				IWorkbenchPage page = PlatformUI.getWorkbench()
						.getActiveWorkbenchWindow().getActivePage();

				page.openEditor(input, sId, true);

			} catch (PartInitException e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			} catch (CoreException e1) {
				e1.printStackTrace();
			} catch (IOException e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}

What it the best way to package up my test case ... ?

thanks,
Evan Williams

Created an attachment (id=76599)
Plugin Project to reproduce problem

This is a small plugin project which demonstrates the problem.

It requires the org.eclipse.ui.examples.filesystem plugin - which provides the memory based filesystem.

The plugin is for a simple RCP application. When the application is launched, select 

File -> Open Editor on a Filestore

to generate the error.
This needs to be fixed for 3.3.1.
Fixed in HEAD and R3_3_maintenance and added org.eclipse.core.filebuffers.tests.FileBufferFunctions.testGetFileStoreAnnotationModel()
